attributes.action: revoke PCO Notice 09/07 allowing Minicab offices to set up in every pub, club and restaurant in London
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
When the requirements for Private Hire (minicabs was decided upon in 2001, there was a rule that the Operator needed to have planning permission to use the base as an operating centre.

This was set up to stop Operators just setting up offices wherever they felt was appropriate rather than where the licensing authority felt was appropriate.

The planning permission requirement was written into the legislation as a protection for the public.

It was therefore surprising when the March 2007 PCO Notice 09/07 removed the requirement for planning permission.

Since the planning permission requirement was abolished it has led to Minicab offices opening up everywhere in London, including nightclubs, restaurants and hotels.

These offices are run simply by a man with a clipboard taking bookings from the public and a row of minicabs waiting for the work he gives them.

This situation is seriously endangering the safety of the public as these are clearly not reputable Minicab offices.

Operators also regularly look for work on the street. Any bookings taken on the street are illegal and therefore uninsured.

The need for planning permission needs to be re-instated to protect the public.
